column4: I'm having trouble accessing my proftpd server from a remote pc.. i can connect fine locally, does ubuntu have a firewall by default that could be blocking remote accees to port 21?
no, it doesn't
if you're behind a "router", that would be why
yeah but i've forwarded the ports
yes, but that doesn't work for ftp
enabled dmz, and disabled its' firewall
what do you mean forwarding ports doesn't work for ftp?
do you know how ftp works?  it uses two connections, one for control and one for data.
the server connects out to the client to send the data, which doesn't work if the client is behind a firewall
well from what i read it uses port 20 for data, and 21 for control.. so why wouldn't forwarding those two ports, plus a range for passive work?
anyway, do you have a solution?
don't use ftp
or get a better router
it's a linksys wrt54g
or forward the ports and accept that the clients won't be able to connect if they're behind a firewall
i cannot connect from a remote pc even if there is no firewall
the other pc is on the internet with no router or anything in front of it?
yes
are you connecting in passive mode?
i've tried both active and passive
ok
i get no route to host either way
and even behind a firewall i can connect to ftp servers running on linux, behing routers
